value.text: Understanding contexts (parte II)

text:
Introduction

The main goal of this game is to help people reinforce their knowledge. In each level, you will find links to other areas of the project that can assist you; feel free to access them whenever necessary. The game score is solely intended to indicate where you can improve your skills, not to judge if a person is good or bad. Each part of the game that you access, your score will increase, because the learning received cannot be discarded.

Controls

During the game, you will have the following controls available:

• Next (): Moves to the next screen. However, if a question screen appears, it will be skipped until an answer is provided.
  • Previous (): Returns to the previous screen. This option is available until the problem-solving stage begins, allowing you to reinforce your knowledge.
  • Skip (): Available during the gameâ€™s introduction, enabling you to jump directly to the main screen.
  • Agree (): Appears only on question screens, indicating that you agree with the question.
  • Disagree (): Appears only on question screens, indicating that you believe the statement is incorrect.

The game

The game starts with an introduction where each screen is displayed for 6 seconds before automatically advancing to the next.

In each game level, you will be presented with a case study. You will also receive hypotheses, and after analyzing the data that supports or refutes them, you will indicate whether you agree () or disagree () with the proposed questions. At the end of each level, the corresponding theory will be presented to you, and you will receive a medal for completing the level ().
To begin the game, click the button .
The game can be updated at any time.
